etymologies: mid 16th century (in an earlier sense). From person + -ed

definitions: In parasynthetic compounds. In early use: †having a physical appearance or figure of a specified type (obsolete). Now only: having selves, identities, or personalities of a specified number; specifically in "three-personed" adjective (of God) having the three modes of being which together constitute the Trinity.

notes.text: full-, tender-personed: see the first element.
